fields.title: Hundredfold (With Persecutions)
fields.speaker: Pastor Tony Ft Pastor Kabi
fields.description:
A call to radical discipleship drawn from Jesus’ encounter with the rich young ruler and His words on following Him—letting go, taking up the cross, and gaining the hundredfold with persecutions. Scriptures: Mark 10:17–31; Luke 9:59–62; Mark 8:34; Matthew 16:24.
Tags: discipleship, surrender, cross, eternal life, kingdom, faith, perseverance

Lyrics

Then one came running to Him and said, "Good Mr., what must I do to inherit this eternal life?"
 
Christ said onto him, "Don't call me good. That's not what you recognize me as. 

Keep the commandments that he had done. Sell what you have and give it to the poor." 
But he had great possessions, so he walked away with his face, "Long, kai." 

Then said onto another, "Come follow me." He said, "Lord, kai. My father just died. 
Suffer me first to pay last respect 
let the dead bury the dead." 
You just take your cross and follow the way it leads. 

What did Jesus say about losing your mom? But you gain a hundred.
What did Jesus say about losing your job? But you gain a hundred with persecutions.

and life turn out to live in the world to come. So the last that become the first and the first become the last. This is the Lord's own wisdom. 

Satan packages his life into silver and gold. [laughs] If Satan wants to distract you now, he's not... How will he distract you before? He will give you offers, 

packages. The devil bring fine boy to you. She gets it. And the first problem with that boy is that you just start hearing him. 

Then when you start hearing him, you stop hearing faith. 

Yes, sir.

fields.title: I Will Not Be Moved (You Are My Story)
fields.speaker: Pastor Doyin Akelere
fields.description:
A bold confession of steadfast faith—anchored in Christ through mountains, oceans, and tribulations—and a testimony refrain: “You are my story, You are my song.” Suggested scriptures: Psalm 16:8; Psalm 62:6; Psalm 125:1; Hebrews 6:19; Daniel 2:21.


Lyrics

[Music]

Hook
Ah—
I will not be moved.

Verse 1
When I see mountains, when I see oceans,
When I see tribulations—
I have revelation, I hold my anchor,
I will not be moved.

(Repeat)
When I see mountains, when I see oceans,
When I see tribulations—
I have revelation, I hold my anchor,
I will not be moved.

Break
Whoa… whoa…
I will not be moved.
Ah… ah…
I will not be moved.
Oh… oh…
I will not be moved.
Ah… ah…
I will not be moved.

Verse 2
Nations rise, nations fall—the end is coming soon.
I’ve seen Your mercies, I have Your Spirit,
I will not be moved.
I’ve seen Your mercies—yes, I’ve seen Your mercies;
I have Your Spirit,
I will not be moved.

Call
Whoo—
I will not be moved.
I will not be moved.

Chant (Lift)
Oh, be lifted above all other gods,
We lay our— … (congregation continues)

Testimony Refrain
This is my story—You are my song.
All day, all night, I will sing of Your faithfulness.

Ad-lib / Exhortation
Listen: it is my story, but it is not my song.
This is my story—You are what I’m singing.
You are my song. All day, all night—
I will sing of Your faithfulness.

Congregational Response
Church, can we sing with a loud voice?
This is my story… Jesus, You are my song—yes!
All day, all night, I will sing—
I will sing of Your faithfulness.

Final Tag
You are my story, You are my song.
All day, all night, I will sing of Your faithfulness.
You are my story, You are my song.
All day, all night, I will sing of Your faithfulness.

fields.title: 01 Salvation Revisited — Glory Night Service
fields.speaker: Pastor Doyin Akerele
fields.description: A clear, Spirit-filled teaching on what salvation truly is—God’s gift by grace through faith—not behavior modification. The message revisits repentance and faith, the new birth, justification vs. sanctification, assurance, and the fruit that follows a transformed life. It corrects common myths (“I’ll be saved when I’m ‘good enough’”) and calls listeners to receive Christ and live out the hope of the gospel. Suggested Scriptures: John 3:3–8,16; Romans 3:23–26; Ephesians 2:8–10; Titus 3:4–7; 2 Corinthians 5:17; 1 John 5:11–13; Titus
fields.tags: salvation, gospel, grace, repentance, new birth, justification, sanctification, assurance, faith, Glory Night
